cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles SSW of Caibarién, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest overnight, then turning northwest Saturday and tracking up the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near the Apalachicola area

weather_observation.watch_coast: South-west coast of Florida from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to the Dry Tortugas, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, southwest and west coasts of Florida, and the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Sustained winds generally below gale force, but occasional gusts to tropical-storm force (39 mph) possible Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near Port Everglades
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated amounts up to 8 inches could cause urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low risk of isolated tornadoes Saturday afternoon and evening
